name: chicken pox
symptoms: Fever, headache and loss of appetite
Dark red-colored rash on the back and chest which spreads on the whole body
After few days these vesicles start drying up and scabs are formed
These scabs start falling (infective stage)
precautions: The patient should be kept in isolation
Clothings and utensils used by the patient should be sterilised
Fallen scabs should be collected and burnt

name: measles
symptoms: Common cold
Appearance of small white patches in mouth and throat
Appearance of rashes on the body
precautions: The patient should be kept in isolation
Cleanliness should be maintained
Antibiotics check only the secondary infections which can easily recur

name: poliomyelitis
symptoms: The virus multiplies in intestinal cells and then reaches the brain through blood
It damages brain and nerves and causes infantile paralysis
Stiffness of neck, fever, loss of head support
precautions: Polio vaccine drop

name: rabies
symptoms: Severe headache and high fever
Painful contraction of muscles of throat and chest
Chocking and fear of water leading to death
precautions: Compulsory immunization of dogs
Killing rabid animals
Anti-rabies injections or oral doses are given to the person bitten by a rabid animal

name: hepatitis
symptoms: Bodyache
Loss of appetite and nausea
Eyes and skins become yellowish, urine deep yellow in color
Enlarged liver
precautions: Proper hygiene is to be observed
Avoid taking fat rich substances
Hepatitis B vaccine is now available in India

name: typhoid
symptoms: continous fever, headache, slow pulse rate
Redish rashes appear on the belly
In extreme excess, ulcers may rapture resulting in death of the patient
precautions: Anti-typhoid innoculation should be given
Avoid taking exposed food and drinks
Proper sanitation and cleanliness should be maintained
Proper disposal of excetra of the patient
Antibiotics should be administered

name: tuberclosis
modeOfTransmission: airborne-discharged through sputum, cough and sneeze of an infected person
symptoms: Persistent fever and coughing
Chest pain and blood comes out with sputum
General weakness
precautions: Isolation of patient to avoid spread of infection
BCG vaccination is given to children as a preventive measure
Living rooms should be airy, neat and with clean sorroundings
Antibiotics should be administered as treatment

name: cholera
symptoms: Acute diarrohea and watery stool
Muscular cramps
Loss of minerals through urine
Dehydration leads to death
precautions: Cholera vaccination should be given
